page.title: 06Shopping in Braintree
page.content: During our investigations we tried to establish people's opinions on Braintree and Bocking as a shopping centre. Many years ago this was a prosperous area but with easy transport links with both Chelmsford and Colchester we wished to know how the public attitude had changed. On questioning members of the public we found most people are generally satisfied with our town although certain members felt it could be improved by making the whole centre a pedestrian precinct rather than just Bank Street. This point may come after the construction of the Braintree Bypass. Our investigations also revealed a need for a larger range of chain stores and Hypermarkets than those already present. To balance this argument one local shopkeeper thought the town should stay the same.
